oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Hottentot legend of a Bushman woman who transformed herself into a lion, as told by Sir. J. Alexander, was translated, through the medium of the Dutch, by /a!kunta. (B I. 161-167)- We have also a second version of this translation. (LI. -1. 114-118.) An account of a woman's transformation into a lion and her return to human form. Her Koranna companion wishes her to hunt for meat for them both but is frightened when she assumes a lion's form and hides up a tree. The woman takes off the lion's skin and becomes a woman again, returning to her child. (Page 160 contains words and sentences) 1) This story is found in Book I.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Wilhelm Bleek notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Woman transformed into a lion
